intro: Oreopanax mutisianus, commonly known as the mountain sarsaparilla, is a tropical plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a climbing shrub that belongs to the Araliaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and spiny stems. The plant features large, palmate leaves with a rough texture and often has clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting various wildlife species. Oreopanax mutisianus is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local medicine.
